lines.content: # Methods and files that are written by AI:
This is a chatbot called Siri that helps you to mangage your tasks.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/siri.siri.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run siri.siri.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Siri is a simple chatbot that helps you **manage tasks** via text commands.
Use the `deadline` command to add a task with a due date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Todos can be added with the `todo` command.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task in the list.
Events can be added with the `event` command, which takes a description, start time, and end time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Use the `list` command to display all tasks currently stored.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Use the `mark` command to mark a task as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Use the `unmark` command to set a completed task back to not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Use the `delete` command to remove a task from the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Use the `find` command to search for tasks containing a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Use the `undo` command to revert the most recent action. You can also undo a specific task modification by index.
Use the `bye` command to exit the chatbot.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* Handles user input, parses it into a command, dispatches to the appropriate handler,
* and returns the formatted response. Persists task changes for mutating commands.
* @param input the raw user input string (may be null or contain leading/trailing spaces)
* @return the formatted response string to display
* Normalizes raw user input by trimming whitespace and replacing null with an empty string.

* @return a trimmed non-null string (empty if input was null or only whitespace)
* Ensures a valid command is extracted from the parser.
* @param parser the parser initialized with user input
* @throws SiriException if no valid command could be identified
